intro: Astragalus physodes subsp. acikirensis, commonly known as the acikirensis milkvetch, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces pods that contain small, round seeds. This subspecies is native to parts of Central Asia and is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions.
